briefTitle: Study of Aripiprazole as an Adjunctive Therapy in Patients With Major Depressive Disorder
officialTitle: Placebo-Controlled, Double-Blind, Parallel Group-Comparison Study of Aripiprazole as an Adjunctive Therapy in Patients With Major Depressive Disorder
summary: To examine the efficacy and safety of aripiprazole versus placebo as an adjunctive therapy co-administered with either an selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) or a serotonin-norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor (SNRI) in patients with major depressive disorder.

primaryOutcome.measure: Mean Change in Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Total Score
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Baseline (the end of the SSRI/SNRI treatment period), at completion of administration
